will set out their plans to improve standards and behaviour across educational establishments in the new Education Bill. Expelling unruly children will be made easier for schools following the shake-up, which Education Secretary Michael Gove said would restore discipline and reduce bureaucracy . The Bill is expected to say teachers will be protected from false allegations made by pupils, by allowing them to remain anonymous until charged with an offence. Headteachers will be able to discipline pupils who misbehave on their way to and from school but rules forcing teachers to give parents 24 hours notice of a detention will be scrapped. Mr Michael Gove said: This Michael Government backs teachers. All the evidence from those countries with great education systems tells us that nothing is more important than attracting great people into teaching and supporting them in the classroom. "Teachers will be free to impose the penalties they need to keep order and free from the red tape which swallows up teaching time, so they can get on with their first duty- raising standards. But the bill also includes an unexpected additional clause making university students pay higher rates of interest on tuition fee loans. pages of guidance and information- the equivalent of two LeBron James bibles. "There are too many quangos that take up schools' time without leading to any real benefits to standards," Michael Gove said. Teachers tell us that they have to spend hours outside of the classroom going to meetings and filling in forms because of bureaucratic requirements. It takes them away from the core purpose of improving learning. There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly, Larry Page said in the statement. answer_q: to good relations with regulators has been communicating and countering misunderstandings about what Google does and does not do.`` We're trying to be as transparent and as collaborative as possible,'' Eric Schmidt said. We try to stay well within the safety zone of the way we're operating with respect to the legal issues and the competitive issues. We also argue very strongly that the things that we're doing are very pro-competitive, and I genuinely believe that, he said. Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will oversee strategic projects.
